Token.Abstract: The DBException class is a subclass of NSException that always has name set to DBExceptionName. A DBException is raised by a failure in an API method which indicates programming errors or internal SDK problems. <!-- paragraph separator in class docs for appledoc bug --> You should generally not have to catch a DBException, but the error property will allow you to classify or translate one if you need to.
Information about the error which caused this exception to be raised.
Information about the error which caused this exception to be raised.
